<blue>Shift + Left-click</>: Transfers a single stack
<blue>Shift + Right-click</>: Transfers a half of stack

<blue>Control + Left-click</>: Transfers all stacks of the given type
<blue>Control + Right-click</>: Transfers half of items of the given type

<blue>Control + Left-click on empty slot</>: transfer the whole inventory
<blue>Control + Right-click on empty slot</>: transfer a half of whole inventory

<blue>Alt + Left-click</>: transfer five items
<blue>Alt + Right-click</>: transfer one item

Press <blue>Left Mouse Button</> while holding a <blue>Screwdriver</> and drag to one of arrow directions then release button to rotate block. At the moment only single cell blocks can be rotatared with this method.

Rotation depends on the plane you are hovering over.
After releasing the button, the plane will rotate in such a way that it replaces the plane indicated by the selected arrow

Press <blue>R</> to rotate the block around vertical axis.
You can change this axis by holding <blue>Shift</> or <blue>Alt</> key.
Active axis will be shown with green arrow and axis like in piclure above.

While holding some buildable item you can hold <blue>Right Mouse Button</> and drag to one of arrow directions then release button to rotate block. This method allows rotation of blocks with any size.

Most blocks have inputs and/or outputs, called Accessors. Accessors are color-coded:
yellow for <yellow>Kinetic</>, blue for <blue>Electricity</>, red for <red>Heat</>.

There is no specific marking on the blocks to indicate whether it's an input or output, but it's usually not hard to guess based on the block's functions. This is also directly mentioned in the item's description.

During the construction of blocks, you can see the Accessors as shown in the image above. To transfer energy from one block to another, it's necessary to arrange them so that Accessors of the same type connect. Also, there are specific conduits for each type of Accessor: Cables for electricity, Heat Pipes for heat, and Flywheels for kinetic energy.

Press <blue>Q</> to copy hovered block with its rotation. Press <blue>Q</> again to clear selection.
It is always working in Creative mode and only when you have same item in inventory in Normal mode

Press <blue>Ctrl+C</> to copy settings from hovered block
Press <blue>Ctrl+V</> to paste setting from clipboard to hovered block

Block settings availible not for all blocks. All block settings is just a text.
